paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

functional_data.summary: The Asp38Ala mutation is the most common in Korea and is associated with increased amyloidogenic propensity.

variants.segregation_data: The hATTR has autosomal-dominant patterns of inheritance, but penetrance is highly variable according to mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of TTR mutations varies significantly based on the specific mutation and demographic factors.
key_quotes: The hATTR has autosomal-dominant patterns of inheritance, but penetrance is highly variable according to mutation.
In Korea, the aspartic acid to alanine substitution at position 38 (Asp38Ala) mutation is currently the most common.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is the most commonly detected mutation associated with cardiac involvement.

variants.segregation_data: The penetrance of this variant is also variable and may depend on age and ethnicity.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is particularly noted for its association with cardiac amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Among the variants of TTR predominantly involving the heart, the valine to isoleucine substitution at position 122 (V122I) is the most commonly detected mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted, but specific patient data was not provided.
